<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

`+ Lean.Name.fromComponents`
`+ findWithExtBase`
`+ getSrcDir`
`- getPackageDir`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

:v: joneugster can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13500068799/job/37716077526)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13500068799/job/37716077088)

```suggestion
  let .some packageDir â† sp.findWithExtBase "lean" mod |
    throw <| IO.userError s!"Unknown package directory for {mod}\nsearch paths: {sp}"
  return packageDir
```
Could you add a docstring? What counts as a "package" directory?

```suggestion
  sp.findM? fun p =>
    (p / pkg).isDir <||> ((p / pkg).addExtension ext).pathExists
```

I don't think this is true. If I test it on `Verso`, the directory it returns is `workspace/verso/src/verso`, but the `.lake` folder is at `workspace/verso/.lake`. If you actually want the lake directory, you need to walk the ancestors until you find it.

A TODO comment about not supporting `srcDir` attributes in `lean_lib` would be acceptable for now.
Or perhaps better a check that `.lake` exists, and erroring with a "not implemented" message when it doesn't.

I've now renamed the function to `getSrcDir` because that's what it effectively does, and I've added the `TODO` and existence test of `.lake/` to `mkBuildPaths` beause that's where we assume no special options are set in `lake`.

```suggestion
    IO.eprintln <| s!"Warning: {packageDir / ".lake"} seems not to exist, most likely `cache` " ++
```
or use `\` in the string, however that works.

```suggestion
`path` is assumed to be the unresolved file path corresponding to a module:
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Cache): refactor getPackageDir to not use manually provided package directories

source.title: feat(Cache): enable partial cache in downstream projects
chore(Cache): remove unused hardcoded package directories
